title.narrative: F.a: Economic Empowerment for Girls and Women in Post-war Liberia

description.narrative: Rural women and girls in remote communities in Liberia are still among the poorest and the most vulnerable groups as they are incapable of generating sufficient income to enable them meet their household needs. Often, there is no empowerment programme espe cially for women in the communities. Women lack small business, micro-credit opportunities and market outlets to improve livelihood and income generation. Moreover, the low economic status of target communities, high illiteracy rate and lack of vocational skills, coupled with community’s insensitivity towards gender issues and human rights issues have placed women and girls at a greater disadvantage. The overall objective of the project is to strengthen the capacities of FAWE Mothers’ Clubs to effective ly and sustainably take on their role of agent of change in empowering vulnerable women and girls in their respective communities.The expected results:1) Improved project implementation as well as the leadership and management skills of the leaders of Moth ers Clubs; 2) Mothers’ Clubs are managed more professionally and profitably, are generating substantial income and investing it in Clubs’ social activities and credit scheme; 3) Literacy and cognitive skills improved among previously disadvantaged memb ers of the Mothers’ Club communities so that they can read and write basic documents, vote confidently and compete in business, and young adults have increased chances to enter and complete secondary school; 4) Improved access to vocational skills for wo men and girls.The project activities will comprise of improving the management and leadership capabilities of the Mothers’ Clubs; enhancing the institutional and financial sustainability of the Mothers’ Clubs; increasing the income–generating capacit ies of targeted beneficiaries in the communities; providing vulnerable girls with training in vocational/life skills, literacy promotion, SME development and community mobilisation for promotion of women’s rights. Rights-holders /beneficiaries: Women an d girls in rural and peri-urban communities.Implementing partner: Forum for African Women Educationalists (FAWE)
